project.name: dont touch your face
project.notes: This illustrates a use of a deep learning model called PoseNet. It defines blocks for obtaining up to 17 locations on one or more people (nose, elbow, knee, etc.). This program tracks the eyes, nose, and wrists and mirrors their movements. If a hand comes close to the face a warning is issued.

block-definition.comment: Reports the distance between two pose elements if they are visible. Otherwise a big number is reported.

block.comment: If not visible then report a number larger than any true distance.

block.l: Once everything has loaded you should see your eyes, wrists, and nose moving.

block.comment: 'poses' can report poses of each person in front of the camera. We only want one.

block.l: shortest distance between a wrist and an eye or nose

block.var: shortest distance between a wrist and an eye or nose

block.comment: You can decide what is too close and how to react.

custom-block.comment: Click to open the interface panel.

block.comment: Ignore pose locations that are less than 50% confident.

custom-block.s: Follow pose %l and adjust y by %n

block.comment: Each pose element has a number used to retrieve its location.

scripts.comment: if confidence in the pose is above the threshold moves this sprite to the location of the pose element.

custom-block.s: Follow pose %l and adjust y by %n
Follow pose %l and adjust y by %n
Follow pose %l and adjust y by %n

scripts.comment: Adjust y by a guess at the distance from the wrist to the center of the hand. Guessing that that is about the same as the distance between the eyes.

custom-block.s: Follow pose %l and adjust y by %n

scripts.comment: Adjust y by a guess at the distance from the wrist to the center of the hand. Guessing that that is about the same as the distance between the eyes.

watcher.var: shortest distance between a wrist and an eye or nose

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of poses. Use 'pose property' to get the locations of body parts and the confidences that the locations are correct.

block.comment: If nearly transparent location can't be trusted.

block-definition.s: Follow pose %'pose' and adjust y by %'adjustment'

block.comment: The fainter I look the less confident we are about the pose.

pose property %s of %txt %txt from %l using stage coordinates %b

block.comment: Can't see both eyes so just guess how far apart they are.

block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block.comment: 'property name' ends with hypen and a number and this extracts that number. Add 0 to ensure it is a number and not text.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.
Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.
Confidence that there is a person at all.
Confidence score
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block-definition.s: poses %'process poses' $nl while hiding the support window %'hide interface'
block-definition.comment: This reports a list of poses captured by the camera. There are 'pose property' reporters for inspecting the values in a pose.

block-definition.s: pose property %'property name' of %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of poses. Use 'pose property' to get the locations of body parts and the confidences that the locations are correct.

custom-block.s: segmentations and poses of costume %s %br with options %l

input.options: Project notes Project name User Presentation mode Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); switch (which) { case 'Project notes': return ide.projectNotes; case 'Project name': return ide.projectName; case 'User': return ide.cloud.username; case 'Presentation mode': return ide.isAppMode; case 'Language': return SnapTranslator.language; case 'Zoom blocks': return SyntaxElementMorph.prototype.scale; case 'Stage size': return new List([StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.x, StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.y]); case 'Stage scale': return stage.scale; case 'Retina display support': return isRetinaEnabled(); case 'Long form input dialog': return InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded; case 'Plain prototype labels': return BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel; case 'Input sliders': return MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput; case 'Execute on slider change': return ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit; case 'Clicking sound': return !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound; case 'Turbo mode': return stage.isFastTracked; case 'Flat design': return MorphicPreferences.isFlat; case 'Keyboard editing': return world.keyboardReceiver instanceof ScriptFocusMorph; case 'Visible stepping': return Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping; case 'Thread safe scripts': return stage.isThreadSafe; case 'Prefer smooth animations': return StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0; case 'Flat line ends': return SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds; case 'Codification support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping; case 'Inheritance support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance; default: return which; case 'Visible palette': return ide.currentCategory; }

block-definition.s: segmentations and poses of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process segmentations and poses' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'

block-definition.comment: reports a list of all pixels in the given costume. Each pixel is represented by a 4-item sublist of RGBA values

block.l: var i, pixels = [], src = costume.contents.getContext('2d').getImageData( 0, 0, costume.width(), costume.height() ); for (i = 0; i < src.data.length; i += 4) { pixels.push(new List([ src.data[i], src.data[i + 1], src.data[i + 2], src.data[i + 3] ])); } return new List(pixels);

block-definition.comment: overwrite the pixels in the given costume with another list of pixels. Caution! This operation directly changes the costume. Make sure to use a copy in case you would like to revert changes later.

block.l: var i, k, ctx = costume.contents.getContext('2d'), src = pixels.asArray(), dta = ctx.createImageData(costume.width(), costume.height()); for (i = 0; i < src.length; i += 1) { px = src[i].asArray(); for (k = 0; k < 4; k += 1) { dta.data[(i * 4) + k] = px[k]; } } ctx.putImageData(dta, 0, 0);

block-definition.comment: reports the sprite's actual current costume, which may or may not be part of its wardrobe e.g. if it is a copy
reports a copy of the given costume. This is especially useful when modifying a costume, so you can keep the original around
LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: display the given bitmap in a copy of the current costume (so you can switch back to the original costume again)
display the given bitmap in a copy of the current costume (so you can switch back to the original costume again)
takes a snapshot with the webcam and reports it as a new costume, or zero if the user cancels
block-definition.translations: pt:$camera a imagem actual do vídeo

block.l: var camDialog, result = false; camDialog = new CamSnapshotDialogMorph( this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), this, function () {result = null; }, function (costume) { result = costume; this.close(); } ); camDialog.key = 'camera'; camDialog.popUp(this.world()); return function () {return result; };

block-definition.s: segmentations and poses of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options'

custom-block.s: segmentations and poses of costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

block-definition.s: Setup camera %'width' %'height' then when ready %'do when camera is ready'
block-definition.comment: Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

custom-block.comment: Check if already ready to avoid the 1 second wait

block.comment: Wait a bit more because otherwise a black image is captured.

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

block-definition.s: Analyse costume %'costume' then $nl %'process response' $nl with the list of label confidences

Train with image buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: This will launch a training window where you can show the system examples of each of the labels in 'bucket names'. If 'add to previous training' is false then training will start over from scratch. Optionally you can provide HTML that will appear instead of the default on the training tab. Finally one can provide commands that will run when the user returns to Snap! from the training panel.

custom-block.comment: When panel is ready then wait for the user to return making the panel hidden.

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is ready to answer queries from Snap!.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: 'message' will be printed on the browser's console.

block-definition.s: Open this in a new tab

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.comment: Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block.l: return ecraft2learn.javascript_to_snap( [ ["not a body part", [0, 0, 0, 0]], ["left face", [255, 0, 0, 255]], ["right face", [255, 0, 0, 255]], ["left upper arm front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left upper arm back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right upper arm front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right upper arm back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left lower arm front", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["left lower arm back", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["right lower arm front", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["right lower arm back", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["left hand", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["right hand", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["torso front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["torso back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left upper leg front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left upper leg back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right upper leg front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right upper leg back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left lower leg front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left lower leg back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right lower leg front", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["right lower leg back", [0, 0, 0, 255]], ["left feet", [0, 255, 0, 255]], ["right feet", [0, 255, 0, 255]] ]);

variable.name: shortest distance between a wrist and an eye or nose
